Park's BBQ Review | Bon Appetit

Park’s is king for a reason.ORDER THE: sweet-savory galbi, glistening pork belly, crispy seafood pancake, and, hell, the Wagyu, if you’re ready to party with some ice-cold soju and the wonderful array of banchan.THE VIBE IS: pretty eclectic but very L.A. You’ll find Korean families alongside K-pop stars, diplomats, and chefs sitting at tableside grills and under big metal tubes, like they’re about to be beamed up to meaty heaven.PRACTICAL STUFF: Open every day: Sunday to Thursday, 11 a.m. to 11 p.m., and Friday and Saturday, 11 a.m. to midnight.—Elyse InamineWE ALSO LOVEThe Walker InnFor when you want something quiet, cool, and intimate in KoreatownGrand Central MarketL.A.’s best bites under one downtown roofRiceBarEverything’s coming up rice bowls in downtown L.A.Explore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
